application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
G4 2 Willows. Would like to Re-Pollard to previous or suitable points removing up to 1.5m of new growth 

T30 1 Chestnut like to crown reduce to previous or suitable points removing up to 1.5-2m of new growth 

T33 1 Lime Would like to crown reduce to previous or suitable points removing up to 2.5m of new growth 

All located on TPO 329.
decision_conditions: Timing of works:  Pruning works should not be carried out during the period of bud burst and care should be taken to ensure that branches are cut back to healthy outward facing buds to avoid die-back to which some species are prone. For major works, such as pollarding or copping, work should only be carried out after the autumn leaf fall when the sap has gone down, and certainly well before the sap rises in the spring before bud burst has taken place.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

The re-growth / re-grown crown of the tree to be re-pollarded shall be removed. All pruning cuts shall be made above the previous pruning / pollard points in such a manner so as to minimise the impact to the tree(s) health and encourage the continued formation of a pollard head.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS3998: 2010 - "British Standard Recommendations for Tree Work". Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of this work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
